lexUnit.name: telephone.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ring or speak to (someone) using the telephone.

sentence.text: George Felse telephoned his wife from the Sallows farm somewhat after eight o'clock in the morning .
However , he telephoned from Kigali on Saturday to say that they had been taken out through the area in which the fighting had taken place without mishap .
The day after we tried to telephone from the post office but could not get through to Alassio .
` She telephoned me from a public call-box somewhere .
The following day , Moira telephoned the Daily Telegraph with profuse apologies for the misunderstanding .
Anyone who is interested should telephone for details of availability .
There they collected the report and the tape recording -- and Derek paused long enough to telephone Carol with a flimsy excuse for his absence .
" Presumably he telephoned for the mechanic before he left . "
Write or telephone for brochure and price details .
Within Switzerland you can also telephone 162 for a weather forecast .
Shall I telephone him back and confirm ? "
The police made inquiries and telephoned back .
Charlotte had telephoned Derek from Boston late on Friday night to ask if he could meet her off the plane at Heathrow on Saturday morning .
The pair were friends for 65 years after meeting at New College , Oxford , and regularly telephoned each other with their latest jokes .
In November Coun Thorne-Wallis , who represents Haughton West ward , telephoned British Rail about the missing fencing below Wylam Hill near Thompson Street East but so far no action has been taken .
So please write or telephone about your problems -- relevant addresses are listed at the back of the prospectus .
Irena said : " I shall have to telephone Miss Lucchesi about the young man .
Last May just days before his finals he telephoned his mother in Singapore to say he 'd taken 200 pills .
Uncle Vernon had telephoned the police on more than one occasion .
Your mother is telephoning the doctor .
Meredith telephoned several numbers without success .
Actually , she telephoned me at the Lab just before two .
Shildon telephoned next , from a callbox , to say he had heard from Eliot that Rain was willing to work with him .
UN peace mediator Cyrus Vance telephoned Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic and he agreed to use his influence to try to clear the way for the UN convoy , stopped at the Serb border .

Later that afternoon , Branson telephoned Clark 's wife , pretending to be the managing director of the company to which Clark was going , and talked gibberish down the telephone .
MORE THAN 2,000 women have telephoned a helpline after the death of a midwife with the HIV virus .
Patrick Seymour telephoned Vice-President Odell personally , on a secure line .
According to the BBC , Mr Mynott telephoned Number 10 at 8.30 this morning with a enquiry .
Alternatively you can telephone our Customer Relations Department on 0742 528788 .
